sentences.sContent: In this month’s competition you could win a prize worth £3,000.
sentences.sCn: 在本月的竞赛中您可以赢得价值3,000英镑的奖品。

sentences.sContent: The first prize has gone to Dr John Gentle.
sentences.sCn: 获得一等奖的是约翰·金特尔博士。

sentences.sContent: The prizes are awarded (= given ) every year to students who have shown original thinking in their work.
sentences.sCn: 这些奖项每年颁发给在学习中表现出创造性思维的学生。

phrases.pCn: （旧时出售捕获船货物后分给立功官兵的）捕获物奖金
赢得头奖；获一等奖；得第一名

words.tran: 有得奖可能的；已获奖的

remMethod.val: 奖品(prize)不能用价格(price)来衡量

trans.tranOther: something that is given to someone who is successful in a competition, race, game of chance etc
